turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Good evening, Odette, who is sick this time?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I asked Odette to take a look at little Anais. She has a rash.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Your brother's here?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Yes, with Fedens and the children.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Thomas wants advice?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: He wants your wisdom.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Let's have dinner first.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Simon, next door, the Charingas' boy.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Homework?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Do something.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Call your friends in the army. Call someone. Victor is harmless. This is a mistake.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Please, be quiet.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: We must do something.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Why didn't you call your contacts in the army?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I couldn't help.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: You could have asked for a favor.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No, I could not. What do you know about favors Tatiana, about barter and deals?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Victor was not a stranger, he was our neighbor.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: He was not family. Family is all that matters. Do you think if you or I were being dragged from here, any one of them would lift a finger to help us?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: They do not have your connections.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Connections? I have no connections, only favors. If I call to help Victor, a General will think "Paul Rusesabagina is a fool. He thinks my favors are so numerous and so insignificant as to waste them on everybody." Then my hard work is doubly squandered. I insult the General and I do not get to use my favor at all. Please leave these things to my good judgment.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Paul! Paul's eyes adjust, he recognizes many of his neighbors, all crowded into this small room. Then he sees their friends Odette and her husband Jean Baptiste.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Jean Baptiste!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: The president has been murdered.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Murdered! By whom?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Where are Thomas and Fedens?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I sent them home. Go and call them.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I tried already. The phones do not work.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Is every Tutsi in the neighborhood here?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: They came through the bushes, over the wall. What could I do?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Send them home. We are not the police. What do we have to protect them?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Please. Let them stay 'til morning. The militia will not come here, they know you are a Hutu with influence.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They know you are Tutsi!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Please, Paul, 'til first light.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Dawn. Then they go.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Oh, my God!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where are you hurt, son?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What is it, Paul.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Stay with the children.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Paul, don't let them die.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Get in.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Them. They almost got us all killed. I have done enough for them! We cannot look after them anymore.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What are you going to do? You cannot drive them out onto the road. They can stay with me.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I will not have them on my conscience. They will stay in my room.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Zozo, get a key for two staff bedrooms. Put these people in them.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: This won't do.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: It will do just fine.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Any luck?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: No answer. Please send someone to get them, please.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'll try.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Has Roger spoken yet?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: No, Odette says he's in shock.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: How can we help him.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: He needs to be in a safe place.  Have you heard from Mr. Garindi?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Give him time.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: This is not bad news, Tatsi. Perhaps they fled or could not make it home. There is hope.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Please go back, bring the children to us.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: My sister is dead, Paul. They would not leave the children.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No. They are not dead. Stop this.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They are being evacuated.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What about us?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We have been abandoned.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Listen to me woman. I said all the whites are leaving. The French, the Italians, even the Belgian UN soldiers.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: But who is left?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't know. Colonel Oliver says the UN has three hundred soldiers for the whole country. Black soldiers, Pakistanis.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: You could leave, Paul.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What are you saying, Tatsi?

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Your card says Hutu. Take our children, go and get the twins, pay money at the roadblocks. Get them out. Please.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Enough of this. We stay together. Let me rest, I will feel better then.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Go to the roof now.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What for Paul.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Do as I say. I will be there soon.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Lynch Bages, 84. Perfect with lamb, or fine rare beef.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: So where is the lamb?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Maybe Gregoire and the witch ate it.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We're running out of beer and other supplies.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I have to go out to get food.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Go out! Where?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: To Rutagunda's place. It is close by.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I have to, Tatiana, we are only as valuable as the service we provide.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: You cannot go alone.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm not going alone. I'll take Gregoire with me. He's a good Hutu, and he wants to impress me now.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Please, Paul, why do we have to go to the roof?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It's alright. This is the only place I can find some peace.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I hear we must pay for everything. How much for this?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: A kiss.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I have a confession. When we met...

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: In Ruhengeri?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes, when you worked as the nurse.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I had you transferred to Kigali.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I bribed the Minister of Health to have you transferred to Kigali.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: To be closer. So that I could marry you.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What was the bribe?  What am I worth to you?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It was substantial.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Tell me what it was.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: A car.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What sort of car?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What does it matter.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I want to know.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: A Volkswagen.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: A Volkswagen!

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: I will not leave without the twins.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We have to get out of here Tatiana.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Please, please try one more time.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'll try but we have to leave, with or without them. I want you to promise.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: A little longer, Paul?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We wait until 7:00. If he is not here with the twins he is not coming. We leave. That was your promise. Go help the children.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Ask them to wait a little longer. For the twins.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Get on the truck, Tatiana.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I have to stay.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: No! Sit down now.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I cannot leave these people. I will wait for the twins.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Let me go. Children get off.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I will follow on the next plane. Go.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I love you. Keep the children safe.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Paul! Then another voice.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: We are almost out of water.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We are almost out of everything.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We have to have a plan.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What sort of plan?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Our children cannot see us die first. If the Militia comes, you must hurry up to the roof. I will meet you there.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Please do not talk like this.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We have to. If I do not come, you must take them all by the hands and jump.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The Diplomat! Tatiana wakens, startled.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I have to go to the Diplomat.

turns.speaker: TATIANA
turns.text: Oh, my babies.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Anais, it is so good to see you.

turns.speaker: SABENA PRESIDENT
turns.text: Can I have your name again?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Paul Rusesabagina, Mr. Godefroid. The house manager. I met you on your last visit.

turns.speaker: SABENA PRESIDENT
turns.text: Yes, Paul, I remember. The Mille Collines is a very important property for Sabena. Our directors believe we should close down, shutter the place until this unrest is over?

turns.speaker: SABENA PRESIDENT
turns.text: Very well. But if this thing gets worse, we must close. If there's anything you need, call anytime.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: There is one thing I need right away.

turns.speaker: SABENA PRESIDENT
turns.text: I managed to get the President of France on the phone.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Thank you, sir, you saved our lives.

turns.speaker: SABENA PRESIDENT
turns.text: Paul, I pleaded with the president to go in and get you all. He told me it will not happen.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SABENA PRESIDENT
turns.text: I can give you many political answers Paul but the truth is that Africa is not worth a single vote to all of them: French, British, Americans.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: Rutaganda's place?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: Beg your pardon sir, you are Hutu. You are safe there.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You are with me, Zozo, don't worry.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: What is it like to fly on a plane, sir?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It depends where you sit Zozo. In coach it is like the bus to Giterama.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: That is why they call it coach?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Maybe. But in business class there are fine wines, linens, Belgian chocolates.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: You have taken business class?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Many times.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Sit up, smile, Zozo, don't attract attention to yourself.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: Boss, some of those men are my neighbors, they know I'm Tutsi.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: Twelve are dead.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: How dead?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where are the receptionists? Where's Gregoire?

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: He has taken the presidential suite.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What! Paul storms off.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where's housekeeping? They won't pick up.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: Sir, no one wants to work. They say the boss has left.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: What do we do with all these people?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Open up the ballroom, we'll put them there. And Zozo tell the kitchen to make rice and beans - a lot of it.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: The lieutenant wants the register.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where has all our beer gone?

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: Sir, Gregoire has been taking beers.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: How much beer?

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: Many beers.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You are my family now, Zozo, my brother. I will get you out of here.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Let us remember this night and tell the world that even in hell there are good people.

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: I saw Gregoire make a call, sir?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: As the trucks go.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What is this about no water?

turns.speaker: ZOZO
turns.text: It's true, sir, the water has been turned off.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Paul. Are you alright?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We have a big problem. The Hutu army have come and ordered us all of us out of the hotel.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Out? Where are you going?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I do not know, sir. I think they will kill us all.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: All. What do you mean all?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The staff, the guests.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: The staff and guests! How many?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Now we have eight hundred guests and one hundred staff. I have ten minutes left.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Paul, are you there?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes, thank you Mr. President.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Paul, if you have one call in all the world to stop this, who would you call?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The French. They supply the Rwandan army.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Paul, do everything you can to buy time. I will call you back.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: For food and clothes, and all that grows, etc, etc. Dear Lord, thank you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Thank you, Roger.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Why the hurry, Roger?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Simon has a new pet. Can I go see it?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No, I don't want you going on the street.

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: Please, papa, I have a secret path.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Who is this Simon?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: There are soldiers.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: ROGER
turns.text: On the street.

turns.speaker: REFUGEE
turns.text: Moses, Moses Seradungu.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: REFUGEE
turns.text: I'm looking for Moses Seradungu's room.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What is his room number?

turns.speaker: REFUGEE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Go downstairs, I will help you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Take a bow, Steven, you've outdone yourself tonight -- scared holy hell out of even me.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: If that's the fact, Price, okay, you've had your fun -- now open the goddamn --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: We'd've been splitsville years ago, with me the richest single woman in recorded history -- but Steven doesn't "believe" in divorce.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Not too big on it myself -- but then again, not on marriage either.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh, he's got no problem with that: I'm his fourth.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: I'm confused.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No need for divorce and that messy division-of-assets thing when they kick before you do.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Easy. You've got to keep still for a bit, the last thing we need is a coronary.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You're the Doctor, sweetheart. 'Guess the atropine worked, then.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Convinced all those that needed convincing: you're an official dead lady.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: And what's Steven's status?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Still alive, but it's just a matter of time. And then will come your miraculous resurrection --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- "oh, no, Officer, I'm very much alive -- just a joke to beat my husband at his own clever game -- What? What do you mean he's dead? It's all my fault, I may as well have killed him myself!"

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: "But you didn't, Ma'am. We have all these witnesses that saw..." well, whoever it ends up being that finally shoots him --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- the James Dean wannabe with the hair trigger --

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: -- or might turn out to be -- very big surprise -- that Jenzen girl. The little bitch has the right stuff. She nearly put a bullet in Price right after your "demise."

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: So what stopped her?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: It's complicated. But don't worry --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- there's already been way too many complications for a very simple plan. You ever find out what happened to Melissa Marr?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: So we don't even know if she's alive or dead --

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: -- Price killed her, there's no other explanation --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- there's plenty: for all we know, Steven's got her spying on us right now --

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: -- bullshit --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- the whole thing is falling apart!

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: It's not, baby. Just a matter of minutes now, before somebody pulls the trigger --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- but nobody has yet, Donald. They just haven't been brought to that breaking point. They have to believe proof-positive that their lives are in danger.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: How much more do they need than your death at his hands?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: But they didn't see it happen, they still have doubts. What we need is another body, and Steven's bloody hands right next to it!

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: And how the hell are we going to do that?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Okay: this may sound crazy, but --

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: If you don't mind me asking... Who are you?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Name's Pritchett. Watson Pritchett. I own the house, my father built it. And now I just need to get you into it. So...

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: More of Price's spook-house bullshit.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Not at all!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Part of the original structure. When it was still an asylum. Guy who ran the place -- Dr. Vannacutt -- found it "inspirational." From some German cathedral a million years ago: "Driving the Demons From the Mind."

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: I'm moved beyond words.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Mr. Price? Mrs. Price? Somebody? Hello??

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Pritchett, take it down a couple hundred decibels, what is your problem?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Problem? No problem -- just want to get my money and get on home -- you know, things to see, people to do?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Why in God's name wasn't this thing removed years ago??

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: It was on my Dad's list of "things to do." But the House did him first.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Jesus H. Christ!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Oh dear.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: If you don't calm the hell down I'm gonna strap you in for electro-shock!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Looks like we're it.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: More to the point. Where's our host?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Oh, for chrissake --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- uh, excuse me, just one quick question? How long before this damn thing unseals itself?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Something just must've...frightened her, that's all.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Yeah...something.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: More the merrier.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: No. I'm going back to try and find Ms. Marr. If she's hurt, I'll tend to her. Dead, then I'm coming back for him.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Now what do we do? We've got to hold him somewhere 'til the police --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- the "Saturation Chamber." Where he wanted to put me.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Don't think it'll be a problem.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: C'mon.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: What are you playing here, Price?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: A very, very scary game. But then look at the bright side: if there's only one of you still upright at dawn, you'll be leaving here with five million dollars in your pocket.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Just for the record: what are the rest of your names?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Donald W. Blackburn, M.D.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: You're not my list.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: I got an engraved -- literally -- invitation -- with my name --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- I'm sure you did.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: There must be some other way out.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Well, until that's found, I think it's a good idea we all stick together.  Or wouldn't that fit into your plans, baby?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Melissa!

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Ms. Marr!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Is she alright?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Even if I were inclined, I've had better -- and a lot safer -- opportunities to kill off a wife.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Three times, to be exact.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Accidents. Fatal. Each of your prior wives, so we've been informed.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Can't imagine by who. I don't suppose the truth would interest you: that I've never had another wife but Evelyn.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Where is it??

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: I don't know!!

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: I'm sorry --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- she's not dead! Just have to get her heart pumping aqain!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Upstairs, too. Come with me, I'll show you another body, a friend of mine named Schecter --

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: -- what was he doing here?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Running all the bells and whistles we set up to scare hell out of everybody --

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Oh, really: who?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Didn't catch his or her name, just followed them down here. Somebody all in white surgical gown.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: If there really is someone else in this house, I think the four of us can handle the situation.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I think one of you has been part and parcel of making this situation!

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Nice touch, Pritchett: subtle.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: As a tumor.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: This thing's going nowhere.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: If this is someone's idea of a joke --

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Put it this way: if it's your face on that tape, Mr. Moses, we're one gunshot away from solving all our problems --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- fuck you!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah, what the hell, I'll go.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: Yeah, me too.

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: -- I did: down here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And I think that's case --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Shouldn't somebody like, stand guard or something -- just in case?

turns.speaker: BLACKBURN
turns.text: I'll stay, if it'll ease your mind.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You sure? You'll be alright by yourself?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I wanna know first: to what do I owe this honor? I mean, I never even heard of this guy.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I'm just the Greeter -- and in that capacity, I now urge you all strongly to --
